content:
First off, I like this puzzle.   You have my upvote.

I had an issue, though, that caused me a lot of grief.  The statement says that '/' in the puzzle input indicates a spare.   However, it's also used to indicate that all pins are knocked down on roll 3 of a tenth-frame strike.   This is not really a spare, though, since there are no rolls to follow to complete a spare's score. 

It seems to be accepted practice to put a / in a real 10th frame "paper" score, but I didn't know that and it's not in the statement.  What made it an issue for me is that this only appears in validators, not in any of the visible test cases.  I discarded two working solutions that passed all tests, but failed validators 3 and 4.  I eventually "cheated" and ran my third version through the "Test in IDE" here, where my issue quickly became apparent.

My suggestion is to change one of the test cases 3 or 4 to include a tenth frame like 'X9/' and maybe mention this in the statement.
There is an error in the puzzle statement. Under "Another example" it states that 19 = 10 + 7 + 3.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I/O format improved. Statement is clear enough. Test cases are tested to be correct.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I like it, it does seem i bit too easy for codin game but ill accept it since i remember my days of struggling with easy codin game puzzles
seems complex to understand. But very interesting.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice contribution. It a must to have in the problems section

To give people a better idea what are the "X" and "/" and what is a frame, you may consider using an image like this in the banner: 
https://ibb.co/CvrjKxT

You can do some graphic editing to merge a score sheet with background of bowling lane/pins/ball to identify it is related to bowling.

I'm now very satisfied with the input data structure.
The I/O structure and format are program-checked. All error fixed.
The remaining issue is the statement. I "feel" it can be improved. However, I'm too familiar with the game rules that I'm not sensitive enough to tell can the statement teach me the rules.
You may have to seek advice from someone not knowing the rules to see if he/she could reasonably understand the statement.

PS
A little bit technical improvement here:
"Next N lines: A string containing 10 frames each separated by a space."
Should be better as:
"Next N lines: Each line is a string containing 10 frames each separated by a space.". May need rewording to avoid two "each" in a sentence.

5
32 7/ 6/ X 2/ X 1/ 11 1/ X 1/

Error found in validator 3

why not have a test case showing perfect score 300?

should the input be this? 
X X X X X X X X X X X X
or this?
X X X X X X X X X XXX

I like it.
I feel the input style is more complicated than a paper form calculation, making it less realistic, which can be improved.

In a score paper, the markings are divided into boxes and easy for human to read. To simulate the boxes, you can provide the score markings in different lines:

X
X
9 -
7 /
- 1
8 1
- -
9 /
X
X
7 -

It also helps the coder to focus on programming the scoring rules (the interesting part) rather than spending too much effort in parsing the inputs (dull routine duty).

I see that you have multiple games in each test case. If splitting into lines looks too long, perhaps keeping them in one line but adding a deliminator, like

1
X, X, 9 -, 7 /, - 1, 8 1, - -, 9 /, X, X, 7 -

After all this is your creation and you have the right to decide what you'd like to see.

I've changed Test 4 to start with a perfect game.

I've also updated a few tests where the last frame wasn't properly formatted in the tests.

Since each frame is separated by a space, the last frame should be "XXX" because each of those rolls occurred in the final frame.

Thanks for the input! I really appreciate it.
Thank you so much for catching that mistake! I've updated the validator.

Thank you so much for the feedback. I think you're correct that it could be more clear. I'm not sure what to change but I will continue to try to revise it.

What do you think about, "Each line is a space separated string containing 10 completed frames."
Thanks for the catch! I've updated the statement.
Thanks for the feedback! I've updated the 3rd test to include an example that covers this case. I will try to write a statement that expresses this well and add it soon.

Each line is a space separated string containing 10 sub-strings. Each sub-string is a frame in a game.

"Frame" is a jargon in bowling. Programmers know string and sub-strings better.

You are welcome. 
Thanks for creating this interesting puzzle which helps promoting bowling sport.

Another option, more concise and easier to parse:

1
X X 9- 7/ -1 81 -- 9/ X X 7-
